Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses Commerce Cloud content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal URL http://xchange.demandware.com

Brand sort order for the category.Only used when the rendering template is superCatLanding.

Used to define the content asset used to populate a grid page banner for a category. This value is applied to all sub-category navigation (cascading) if no specific catBannerID has been defined for a sub-category.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.
Disable FlyOut Delay for this category.

attribute-definition.display-name: Do Not Show under all brands
attribute-definition.description: Do Not Show under all brands.

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Which way to orient the menu and optional header menu HTML. Vertical will list all in one line. Horizontal will list in columns.

attribute-definition.display-name: Not to display Brand Filter for ALT URL
attribute-definition.description: Not to display Brand Filter for ALT URL.
Show Brand Header Navigation.

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll-over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll-over navigation.
Show Sub Categories only for listing page.

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.
Image used on either the top or bottom slot on the category landing pages.
Slot Banner Style (height:200px;width: 100%; object-fit: cover;).

attribute-definition.display-name: Pay Pal API Credit Banner Styles
attribute-definition.description:
Return style configurations for Pay Pal Credit Banner (cart, product, category ) Available values: layout: 'flex', // flex, text styleColor: 'gray', // only for flex layout: blue, black, white, white-no-border, gray ratio: '8x1', // only for flex layout: 1x1, 1x4, 8x1, 20x1
{"cartCreditConfig":{"layout":"flex","styleColor":"gray","ratio":"8x1","logoType":"primary","logoPosition":"left","textColor":"black"},"productCreditConfig":{"layout":"text","styleColor":"blue","ratio":"8x1","logoType":"primary","logoPosition":"left","textColor":"black"},"categoryCreditConfig":{"layout":"flex","styleColor":"blue","ratio":"20x1","logoType":"primary","logoPosition":"left","textColor":"black"}}
The merchant for whom you are facilitating a transaction.
This determines whether the funds are captured immediately or later (Authorization)

attribute-definition.display-name: Pay Pal API Smart Button Styles
attribute-definition.description:
Return style configurations for Pay Pal smart button (cart, billing pages) * Available values: * height: (number) from 25 to 55, * color: (string) gold, blue, silver, black, white, * shape: (string) pill, rect, * layout: (string) horizontal, vertical, * tagline: (boolean) true, false
Default value: { "cart":{"height":35,"color":"gold","shape":"rect","layout":"vertical","label":"checkout","tagline":false}, "checkout":{"height":35,"color":"gold","shape":"rect","layout":"vertical","label":"checkout","tagline":false}, "minicart": { "height": 35, "color": "gold", "shape": "rect", "layout": "vertical", "label": "checkout", "tagline": false }, "pdp": { "height": 35, "color": "gold", "shape": "rect", "layout": "vertical", "label": "checkout", "tagline": false } }
The proper name of the city used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.
The proper name of the city used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.

The country used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). You can use a Data Extract report to see the valid country values. (Refer to the Vertex Central online help for information on running Data Extract reports.) Defaults to the value of the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.DefaultCountryCodeForAddress parameter. The default value for this parameter is USA. (For details on this configuration parameter, refer to the Configuration File Parameters Reference Guide.)

The country used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). You can use a Data Extract report to see the valid country values. (Refer to the Vertex Central online help for information on running Data Extract reports.) Defaults to the value of the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.DefaultCountryCodeForAddress parameter. The default value for this parameter is USA. (For details on this configuration parameter, refer to the Configuration File Parameters Reference Guide.)
Helps Vertex determine the correct taxing jurisdictions in cross-border transactions
Include detailed debug information in XML request/response

attribute-definition.display-name: API Lookup Tax Area Endpoint URL

attribute-definition.description: The proper name or the postal abbreviation of the state, province, or territory used to determine the Tax Area ID if none is supplied. Optional (0..1) but is recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.

The proper name or the postal abbreviation of the state, province, or territory used to determine the Tax Area ID if none is supplied. Optional (0..1) but is recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.

The postal code used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). For valid formats, see the Supporting Information section in the XML Integration Guide. Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.

The postal code used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). For valid formats, see the Supporting Information section in the XML Integration Guide. Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.

SEO Cloud key value as defined in your BV platform account. This key is only required if Cloud SEO is enabled.

Deployment Zone Name as defined in your BV platform account
Turn on BV Questions & Answers. This will enable display of Q&A content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on the BV Pixel tag on the DW purchase transaction (checkout) page. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on the BV SEO solution. This will include SEO-friendly content (located in the BV SEO cloud) in your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on inline ratings. This will enable display of product rating statistics on your category and search results pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on BV Ratings & Reviews. This will enable display of R&R content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
BV environment that this DW instance type is integrating with

Colon separated value pairs that define how DW Locales are mapped to BV Locales. DW Locales must be enabled in the current DW Site. BV Locales must be enabled within your BV platform acocunt. Format: ["(DW Locale ID)":]"(BV Locale)"

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed
This determines whether to use the purchase date or ship date when calculating which purchases to include in the purchase feed.
Either Inline Rating stars (will honor the inline rating type: hosted vs native), or PDP summary stars (hosted)
